column4: I've installed dvb-apps and kafeine, downloaded the firmware for my dvb usb stick (dvb-usb-vp7045-01.fw  on linuxtv.org). I have placed it on /lib/firmware but after reboot Ubuntu assistant for digital TV installation doesn't recognize my dvb receiver.
is the device seen by the OS ?
ok, so you need to address that before dealing with any applications
is the card supported by linux ?
ok - so what does the syslog say about it, why can't it be seen
open it with a text editor
w_scan give me main:3118: FATAL: ***** NO USEABLE DVB-T CARD FOUND. *****
I told you to forget about the application until you get the system to see it
how can I add my peripherics on the systeme?
you need to see if the system sees the device and what warning/error it gives when it see it in the sylog
with cat and grep can you help my to parse my syslog file?
read through the syslog, look for the device and read the errors/warnings ?
i thinks the error msg is "Nov 20 19:29:21 media-serveur kernel: [ 6964.144037] usb 2-1: device descriptor read/64, error -62"
sadly that doesn't give us much
I don't found any other error
